intro: Hedeoma bicolor, commonly known as the purple coneflower, is a flowering plant native to North America. It is characterized by its showy, violet to purple flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as prairies and woodland edges. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a silvery underside, giving it a distinctive appearance. Hedeoma bicolor is a member of the sunflower family (Asteraceae) and is known for its ecological importance as a nectar source for pollinators.
